fr.gouv.vitam.tools.mailextract.lib.core

Class StoreMessage

  • Object
    • fr.gouv.vitam.tools.mailextract.lib.core.StoreElement
      • fr.gouv.vitam.tools.mailextract.lib.core.StoreMessage
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JMStoreMessage, MicrosoftStoreMessage

    public abstract class StoreMessage
extends StoreElement
    Abstract class for store element which is a mail box message.

    It defines all information (descriptive metadata and objects) to collect from a message and the method to generate directory/files structure from this information. Each subclass has to be able to extract these informations from a message.

    It is able to generate a mime fake of the message, if not natively Mime.

      Metadata information to collect in Vitam guidelines for mail extraction

    • Subject (Title metadata),
    • List of "From" addresses (Writer metadata),
    • List of "To" recipients addresses (Addressee metadata),
    • List of "Cc" and "Bcc" recipients addresses (Recipient metadata),
    • Message unique ID given by the sending server (OriginatingSystmId metadata),
    • Sent date (SentDate metadata),
    • Received date (ReceivedDate metadata),
    • Message unique ID of the message replied to (and in some implementation forwarded) by the current message (OriginatingSystemIdReplyTo metadata),
    • Message body textual content
      • In the descriptive metadata is also added the DescriptionLevel, which is Item for message and for Attachements.

      Metadata information extracted for study

    • List of "Reply-To" addresses (ReplyTo metadata),
    • List of "Return-Path" addresses, more reliable information given by the first mail relay server (ReturnPath metadata),
    • Complete mail header (MailHeader metadata), contains more metadata which is kept in mime fake generation.

      • Content information extracted

    • All Body Content, text, html and rtf extraction of the message body, when it exists,
    • Attachments, content with filename,

    All values can be null, it then express that the metadata is not defined for this message.

      • getMimeContent

        public byte[] getMimeContent()
        Gets the message rfc822 form

        Either the original content if mime message or a fake mime message generated form, generated during extraction operation.

        Important: this is computed during message extraction

        Returns:
        the mime content

      • getLogger

        public java.util.logging.Logger getLogger()
        Gets the logger created during the store extractor construction, and used in all mailextract classes.

        For convenience each class which may have some log actions has it's own getLogger method always returning the store extractor logger.

        Returns:
        logger

      • detectStoreAttachments

        protected void detectStoreAttachments()
        Detect embedded store attachments not identified during parsing.

        It use for this, the list of mimetypes that can be treated by known store extractors. This list is constructed using StoreExtractor.addExtractionRelation, and a default one is set calling StoreExtractor.initDefaultExtractors

      • getNativeMimeContent

        protected abstract byte[] getNativeMimeContent()
        Gets the native mime content, if any, or null.
        Returns:
        the native mime content

      • analyzeAppointmentInformation

        protected abstract void analyzeAppointmentInformation()
        Analyze the appointment information if any in the message, or null.

      • analyzeMessage

        public void analyzeMessage()
                    throws ExtractionException
        Analyze message to collect metadata and content information (protocol specific).

        This is the main method for sub classes, where all metadata and information has to be extracted in standard representation out of the inner representation of the message. If needed a fake raw SMTP content (.eml) is generated with all the body formats available but without the attachments, which are extracted too.

        Throws:
        ExtractionException - Any unrecoverable extraction exception (access trouble, major format problems...)

      • extractMessage

        public final void extractMessage(boolean writeFlag)
                          throws ExtractionException
        Create the Archive Unit structures with all content and metadata needed, and then write them on disk if writeFlag is true.

        This is "the" method where the extraction structure and content is mainly defined (see also StoreFolder.extractFolder and StoreFolder.extractAllFolders).

        Parameters:
        writeFlag - write or not flag (no write used for stats)
        Throws:
        ExtractionException - Any unrecoverable extraction exception (access trouble, major format problems...)

      • countMessage

        public void countMessage()
                  throws ExtractionException
        Add this message in the folder accumulators for number of messages and total raw size of messages.
        Throws:
        ExtractionException - Any unrecoverable extraction exception (access trouble, major format problems...)
